title: Evolution and Natural Selection Evidence

vocab.definition: Process where organisms better adapted survive and reproduce
Inherited trait that increases survival and reproduction
Evidence of past life preserved in rocks showing change over time
All living things share a common ancestor
Similar structures in different species from common ancestry

teachingNotes: Use examples like peppered moths and Darwin's finches. Emphasize evidence from fossils, anatomy, and DNA. Distinguish natural selection from evolution.

truefalse.question: Natural selection means better adapted organisms survive. (True or False)
Adaptations are learned behaviors. (True or False)
The fossil record shows life has changed over time. (True or False)
All living things share a common ancestor. (True or False)
Homologous structures indicate common ancestry. (True or False)
Natural selection is random. (True or False)
Adaptations are inherited traits. (True or False)
Fossils provide evidence for evolution. (True or False)
All species never change. (True or False)
DNA provides evidence of common descent. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What is an inherited helpful trait?
What are similar structures from common ancestry?
What does the fossil record show?

fillintheblank.question: _____ selection means better adapted organisms survive.
An _____ is an inherited trait that increases survival.
The _____ record shows past life in rocks.
_____ descent means all life shares a common ancestor.
_____ structures are similar from common ancestry.

shortanswer.question: What is natural selection?
expectedAny: Process where better adapted organisms survive and reproduce

shortanswer.question: What is an adaptation?
expectedAny: Inherited trait that increases survival and reproduction

shortanswer.question: What evidence supports evolution?
expectedAny: Fossil record, DNA similarities, homologous structures
Multiple lines including fossils and DNA

shortanswer.question: What is the fossil record?
expectedAny: Preserved evidence of past life showing change over time

shortanswer.question: What is common descent?
expectedAny: All living things share a common ancestor
All life is related through common origin

shortanswer.question: What are homologous structures?
expectedAny: Similar structures in different species from common ancestry
Same basic structure from shared ancestor

shortanswer.question: How does natural selection work?
expectedAny: Organisms with better traits for environment survive and reproduce more

shortanswer.question: Why are adaptations important?
expectedAny: They increase survival and reproductive success

shortanswer.question: What does fitness mean?
expectedAny: Reproductive success and passing genes to offspring
Success in passing traits to next generation

shortanswer.question: How do fossils support evolution?
expectedAny: They show species have changed over time
Demonstrate gradual change in life forms
